metadata.subject: Analysis of the 2011 Oscar race and events surrounding the 84th Academy Awards

organizations: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences

relationships.description: Weinstein Company distributed and promoted the French film 'The Artist'
Domestic partners mentioned together during Oscar night
Weinstein promoted Streep's Oscar campaign for 'The Iron Lady'

analysis.purpose: To provide an insider's account of the 2011 Oscar race and surrounding events
analysis.significance: Detailed behind-the-scenes look at Hollywood awards season politics and social dynamics

notable_quotes: "A statue does not change your life. You still get a cold. You can't get a date. You still have everyday things to worry about." - Woody Allen on Oscars
"She hasn't won in 29 years!" - Harvey Weinstein's last-minute promotion for Meryl Streep
"The Frenchman is winning." - George Clooney whispering about the Oscar race

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this Hollywood awards season narrative

illegal_activity.description: Document contains no discussion or evidence of illegal activity - it's a celebratory account of Hollywood awards events

details: References to media coverage of Oscar campaigns
Mentions of red carpet events and press rooms
Discussion of Vanity Fair party and media presence

public_knowledge.context: Oscar campaigns and awards events are highly publicized media events covered extensively by entertainment journalism

analysis.summary: This document provides an insider's detailed account of the 2011 Oscar race, following nine major films from their Cannes premieres through the Academy Awards ceremony, including behind-the-scenes campaign strategies, celebrity interactions at numerous Hollywood parties, and the eventual victory of 'The Artist' as the first silent film to win Best Picture since 1927.
